Dating: NAQADA II (not before); NAQADA; NAQADA III (not after)
Name: Vase in the form of a frog
Description: This small vase of black stone, which dates from the Naqada II-III Period, represents a frog. It served as a container of perfume essences. The piece was offered to the Museum in 1910 by Baron E. Empain.
